main event: A sighting of an unidentified flying object (UFO) occurred in Brooklyn, New York on July 15, 1953, at 9:00 PM. The object was observed to be a single white light moving at a constant speed and was lost from sight after approximately 5 minutes. The observed trajectory matched the description of a probable meteor, according to the report from Project Blue Book.
interesting points: The object was first observed at an azimuth of 270 degrees and an elevation of 45 degrees, and it maintained a constant course and speed.
Witnesses were asked about the weather conditions, speed, and proximity of the object, as well as their educational training and prior sightings.
The report contains sketches showing how to mark the position of the observed object and examples of how to complete a larger sketch based on the observer's sighting.
A witness described seeing a saucer-sized metallic object floating above the trees, accelerating upwards with no sound or vapor trail; the witness thought it could be a new type of military aircraft.
Another witness described seeing a pearly-colored light moving swiftly in a straight line from the east, north-east and disappearing quickly.

The witness reported that they could not believe their eyes at first and suspected it to be a new type of military aircraft. The lack of markings, sound, or vapor trail led the witness to provide a detailed description of the sighting in the report.
sighted object: single white light resembling a probable meteor
witnesses: Multiple witnesses, one described as a 'strip clerk' at 37 years old and another as a resident of downtown Brooklyn
